ygData.subject: Re: Lab 5 (Malice/Wolfblade)
ygData.msgSnippet: Exiting the atmosphere is no problem.  Maybe we can rig a repulser field to push it out there.  I m sure we can reconfigure the main tractor emitter to suit

--0-782430482-1078202448=:73391
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii

"Exiting the atmosphere is no problem.  Maybe we can rig a repulser field to push it out there.  I'm sure we can reconfigure the main tractor emitter to suit our purposes."
Malice took the generator and check the hole in the sphere for size.  It would fit, so he fit it inside and plugged it up with the cross section he cut.  He used the sword to seal the hole and the sphere itself was ready.
"I'm tired.  I use a bunch of energy cutting on this thing."
He let a yawn escape, and rested his weight against the sphere.
 
OOC- You're back!  Yeah!  Remember, beat up your boss!  He can't do that to you!  

shadowess_azogoth <shadowess_azogoth@...> wrote:
Wolfblade::

She watched Malice work on the sphere. She was impressed by his sheer 
strength, but kept working. She put the finishing touches on the 
machine and sighed. "It's done. Now, once we get this inside the your 
big ball there, how are we going to get it outside the planet's 
atmosphere without the whole thing melting, buring up, or just 
returning to earth?"


--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, robert riley <bustercross365@y...> 
wrote:
> While Wolfblade made the final adjustments to the generator, Malice 
was about to 'adjust' the sphere.  They needed the generator inside 
the basalt sphere, so the easiest way would be to cut it open and 
install.  Malice drew his sword.  It looked like a hammered out 
backbone.  It was more of a saw than a sword.  It also had cables 
running the length from the tip to the hilt.  When the bottom half of 
the handle was unscrewed and slid inside the other half, it created a 
whip like saw weapon.  Malice could also channel energy into it, 
making it more or less leathal.  In this application, Malice poured 
so of his stored energy into it, making it like a torch.  He plunged 
the blade into the sphere and in a circular motioin, cut a cross 
section wide enough to slide the generator inside.  He pulled the 
section out and drew out the heat so he could set it down.  All that 
was left was installing the generator and figure out where they were 
going to launch it.
> 
> shadowess_azogoth <shadowess_azogoth@y...> wrote:WOlfblade::
> 
> She was glad to be back in the lab. Malice was obviously 
> uncomfortable around her as his body language showed very well. Her 
> systems were re-setting themselves, but it seemed to taking an 
> eternity for her.  She glanced up at Malice and felt her belly turn 
> upside down.  She picked up a small set of tools and started to 
> finish the small touches on thier project. "Uh, by the way, erhm, 
> well, thanks for your help. Back there....I mean."  She tried to 
hide 
> her face behind the large sphere on the work bench. She wasn't sure 
> why some of her circuits were acting as funny as they were. Or wny 
> some of her lanugage skills went haywire a little while ago. She 
told 
> herself she would put herself in a CR chamber when this was done 
and 
> run a complete diognostic on herself. However, she had to admit, 
even 
> to herself, she thought she was feeling something when she thought, 
> saw or looked at Malice. She looked and found herself staring at 
the 
> sphere as she had gotten lost in thought, She shook her head and 
> returned to work. "Hope this works. I'd hate to battle this bot in 
> hand to hand combat."
> 
> 
> 
> "I am Des Wraith, the Archfiend of Flames.  I have slaughtered 
thousands of demons who opposed me in my struggle in creating a true 
utopia.  And I will keep Killing them, until I achieve this sacred 
mission.  And not even the great King of All Demons can stop my 
awesome wrath!  He will break before my onslaught!  LET THE SLAUGHTER 
BEGIN!"
>
